page.title: 05West Bay Harbour
page.content: The Harbour is the focal point of West Bay. Something is always happening: the return of fish as the tide flows, unloading of phosphate cargoes from Antwerp, landing the catch of shellfish from the inshore pots, arrival of pleasure boats and commercial angling craft after a day at sea and as the tide ebbs, the scouring of the bed when the sluice gates are opened. Cargo ships up to 270 registered tonnage arrive at high tide, if they can be turned around in the 165 feet available corner to corner of the harbour.The last timber ship arrived in 1976. Outgoing cargoes still include pea gravel from Chesil beach, used for motor test tracks, escape routes on steep hills, grinding of cosmetics and sewage filter beds.
